definitions.definition: (heading) To use or experience the sense of touch.
(heading) To sense or think emotionally or judgmentally.
To be or become aware of.

definitions.example: It looks like wood, but it feels more like plastic.
I don't want you back here, ya feel me?
The wool on my arm produced a strange feeling.
The house gave me a feeling of dread.

definitions.definition: (always in the plural) Emotional state or well-being.
definitions.example: You really hurt my feelings when you said that.

definitions.definition: (always in the plural) Emotional attraction or desire.
definitions.example: Many people still have feelings for their first love.
He has no feeling for what he can say to somebody in such a fragile emotional condition.
Despite the rough voice, the coach is surprisingly feeling.

definitions.definition: Expressive of great sensibility; attended by, or evincing, sensibility.
definitions.example: He made a feeling representation of his wrongs.
